Data Structures | Macros | Functions | Variables
Crypto Utility Functions
utils

Detailed Description

Purpose: This module provides cryptographic utility functions for secure operations across Ambiq Micro devices. It enables encryption, decryption, hashing, and random number generation for embedded applications requiring security features. The utilities support various cryptographic algorithms and secure key management.

Key Features

  1. Encryption: Support for multiple encryption algorithms.
  2. Key Management: Secure key storage and handling.
  3. Random Numbers: Hardware-based random number generation.
  4. Hashing: Cryptographic hash function support.
  5. Security Features: Protected operation modes.

Functionality

  • Initialize and configure crypto hardware
  • Perform encryption/decryption operations
  • Generate random numbers
  • Compute hash values
  • Manage cryptographic keys

Usage

  1. Initialize crypto with am_util_crypto_init()
  2. Perform cryptographic operations
  3. Generate random numbers as needed
  4. Clean up sensitive data

Configuration

  • Select cryptographic algorithms
  • Configure key storage options
  • Set security parameters
  • Define operation modes

◆ am_util_crypto_abort()

void am_util_crypto_abort ( void )

◆ am_util_crypto_ambiq_time_structure_set()

void am_util_crypto_ambiq_time_structure_set ( am_hal_rtc_time_t * atm)

Crypto Set Ambiq RTC structure.

Note
To be used with cryptocell library builds only

Use this function to create a local structure in user code to pass for use in am_util_crypto_get_time

◆ am_util_crypto_calloc()

void * am_util_crypto_calloc ( size_t num,
size_t size )

Calloc implementation tailored to LibCrypto's needs.

Parameters
num- number of buffers to calloc
size- size of buffers to calloc
Returns
pointer to space calloc'ed

◆ am_util_crypto_exit()

void am_util_crypto_exit ( uint32_t exitCode)

Crypto Exit.

Parameters
exitCode- Exit Code

◆ am_util_crypto_free()

void am_util_crypto_free ( void * ptr)

Minimal implementation of Crypto Free.

Note
This implementation of free can only free memory from the fixed-size buffer pool. It ignores all other requests.
Parameters
ptr- pointer to buffer to free

◆ am_util_crypto_get_time()

time_t am_util_crypto_get_time ( time_t * time)

Crypto Get Time for mbedtls libraries.

Note
To be used with cryptocell library builds only. RTC structure should be defined in code per crypto_self_test example
Parameters
time- pointer to time structure - will be unsued and is a carryover from the library
Returns
time_t - Calculated time in seconds since 1/1/1970 until current RTC time

Note
To be used with cryptocell library builds only
